item.title: 微软提醒企业和政府注意服务器软件攻击
item.description: 微软发布了关于政府机构和企业在组织内部共享文档时使用的服务器软件受到 "主动攻击 "的警报，并建议客户立即应用安全更新。【原文：Microsoft has issued an alert about "active attacks" on server software used by government agencies and businesses to share documents within organizations, and it recommended security updates that customers should apply immediately.】

item.title: 投资者称日本执政党大选失利是代价所在
item.description: 分析师说，日本周日举行的上议院选举对执政联盟造成了沉重打击，并使市场面临可能的政策瘫痪和更大的财政赤字。【原文：Japan's upper house election on Sunday dealt a big blow to the ruling coalition and sets markets up for possible policy paralysis and a bigger fiscal deficit, much of which is already priced in, analysts said.】

item.title: 商务部长卢特尼克表示相信美国将与欧盟达成贸易协议
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）周日表示，他有信心美国能与欧盟达成贸易协议，但8月1日是关税生效的最后期限。【原文：U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said on Sunday he was confident the United States can secure a trade deal with the European Union, but August 1 is a hard deadline for tariffs to kick in.】

item.title: 中国 Zeekr 称未销售或注册零里程二手车
item.description: 中国汽车公司 Zeekr 周日在一份声明中说，媒体报道中描述的零里程二手车是已投保的展览车，但该公司并未销售或注册这些车辆。【原文：Chinese automotive firm Zeekr said in a statement on Sunday that used cars described in media reports as having zero mileage were exhibition cars that were insured, but it did not sell or register them.】

item.title: 6 月份中国对美国的稀土磁铁出口猛增
item.description: 分析师说，由于 6 月份有更多的出口商获得了许可证，7 月份磁铁的出货量可能会进一步恢复。【原文：Shipments of magnets are likely to recover further in July as more exporters obtained licences in June, analysts said.】

item.title: 天文学家公司首席执行官在接吻视频疯传后辞职
item.description: 科技公司 Astronomer Inc. 周六表示，该公司首席执行官在摇滚音乐会上与一名并非其妻子的女子亲热时被摄像头拍到，因此已经辞职。【原文：The CEO of the technology firm Astronomer Inc. has resigned after being caught canoodling on camera at a rock concert with a woman who was not his wife, the company said on Saturday.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，英伟达在华重启生产面临障碍
item.description: 据《The Information》周六报道，英伟达（Nvidia）已告知其中国客户，根据美国出口限制，该公司获准向中国出售的最强大的人工智能芯片--H20芯片供应有限，且不打算重启生产。【原文：Nvidia has told its Chinese customers it has limited supplies of H20 chips, the most powerful AI chip it had been allowed to sell to China under U.S. export restrictions, and that it doesn't plan to restart production, The Information reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 独家报道中国电动汽车品牌Zeekr和Neta利用保险计划虚增汽车销量
item.description: 根据路透社查阅的文件以及对经销商和买家的采访，中国电动汽车品牌网大和极客近年来夸大了销量，以达到激进的目标，其中网大夸大了6万多辆汽车的销量。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle brands Neta and Zeekr inflated sales in recent years to hit aggressive targets, with Neta doing so for more than 60,000 cars, according to documents reviewed by Reuters and interviews with dealers and buyers.】

item.title: 中国计划禁止新车在注册后六个月内转售
item.description: 周六，一份行业协会出版物称，中国工业部正计划禁止新车在注册后六个月内转售，以解决零里程二手车的销售问题。【原文：China's industry ministry is planning to ban the resale of new cars within six months after their registration, an industry association publication said on Saturday, in an attempt to address sales of zero-mileage used cars.】

item.title: 据 ANI 报道，印度就博彩应用程序案传唤谷歌和 Meta
item.description: 据 ANI 新闻社周六援引官方消息报道，印度负责调查经济犯罪的执法局已传唤谷歌和 Meta 的代表，要求他们在周一就一起涉及博彩应用程序的案件出庭。【原文：India's Enforcement Directorate agency, which probes economic crimes, has summoned representatives from Google and Meta to appear on Monday in connection with a case involving betting apps, ANI news agency reported on Saturday, citing official sources.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，Blackstone 退出财团对 TikTok US 的竞购
item.description: 一位熟悉此事的消息人士周五告诉路透社，私募股权投资巨头 Blackstone 已退出寻求投资 TikTok 美国业务的财团。【原文：Private equity giant Blackstone has withdrawn from a consortium seeking to invest in TikTok’s U.S. operations, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: Perplexity 正与手机制造商洽谈在设备上预装 Comet AI 移动浏览器事宜
item.description: 由英伟达（Nvidia）支持的Perplexity AI（一家以人工智能搜索引擎挑战谷歌的初创公司）首席执行官阿拉温德-斯里尼瓦斯（Aravind Srinivas）周五告诉路透社，该公司正在与移动设备制造商商讨在智能手机上预装其新的Comet浏览器。【原文：Nvidia-backed Perplexity AI, the startup challenging Google with its AI-powered search engine, is in discussions with mobile device makers to pre-install its new Comet browser on smartphones, CEO Aravind Srinivas told Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 美国法官就终止对波音公司的刑事起诉举行听证会
item.description: 一名美国法官周五表示，他将于 8 月 28 日就司法部和波音公司提出的一项请求举行听证会，以批准一项允许该飞机制造商避免被起诉的协议。【原文：A U.S. judge on Friday said he will hold an Aug. 28 hearing on a request by the Justice Department and Boeing to approve an agreement that allows the planemaker to avoid prosecution.】

item.title: 洛杉矶起诉 Airbnb 在野火后涉嫌哄抬价格
item.description: 洛杉矶市检察官海迪-费尔德斯坦-索托（Hydee Feldstein Soto）周五表示，洛杉矶起诉 Airbnb，指控这家房屋租赁公司在 1 月份南加州野火期间允许价格欺诈，影响了 2000 多处房产。【原文：Los Angeles sued Airbnb , accusing the home rental company of allowing price gouging affecting more than 2,000 properties during January's wildfires in southern California, City Attorney Hydee Feldstein Soto said on Friday.】

item.title: 加密货币公司 Bullish 申请在美国上市
item.description: 加密货币公司 Bullish 周五在美国提交了首次公开募股申请。【原文：Cryptocurrency firm Bullish on Friday filed for an initial public offering in the United States.】

item.title: 法庭记录显示，唐纳德-特朗普起诉道琼斯、新闻集团、鲁珀特-默多克和《华尔街日报》记者诽谤
item.description: 法庭记录显示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五对道琼斯公司、新闻集团、鲁珀特-默多克（Rupert Murdoch）和两名《华尔街日报》记者提起诉讼，根据联邦诽谤法提出索赔。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump filed a lawsuit on Friday against Dow Jones, News Corp , Rupert Murdoch and two Wall Street Journal reporters, raising claims under federal libel law, court records show.】

item.title: MIAX 母公司迈阿密国际申请在美国上市
item.description: 拥有期权交易所迈阿密国际证券交易所（MIAX）的迈阿密国际控股公司（Miami International Holdings）周五在美国提交了首次公开募股申请。【原文：Miami International Holdings, which owns the options exchange Miami International Securities Exchange (MIAX), on Friday filed for an initial public offering in the United States.】

item.title: 交易日：关税阴云再次笼罩阳光明媚的华尔街
item.description: - 交易日【原文：- TRADING DAY】

item.title: 消息人士称，联合太平洋公司与诺福克南方公司探讨跨洲铁路合并事宜
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士透露，美国最大的货运铁路运营商联合太平洋公司（Union Pacific）正在探讨收购诺福克南方公司（Norfolk Southern）的可能性，以打造一个价值 2,000 亿美元的海岸至海岸铁路网络。【原文：Union Pacific , the largest U.S. freight railroad operator, is exploring a possible acquisition of Norfolk Southern to create a $200 billion coast-to-coast rail network, a person familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，没有传统汽车销售经验的特斯拉 IT 高管正在负责销售工作
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，特斯拉的销售团队正在由一位相对鲜为人知的信息技术高管管理，这家电动汽车制造商正在努力应对销量下滑的困境。【原文：A relatively little-known information technology executive is running Tesla's sales team as the electric carmaker grapples with a sales freefall, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 加密货币行业在关键一周市值突破 4 万亿美元
item.description: 根据CoinGecko的数据，加密货币行业的市值在上周五达到了4万亿美元，这是一个里程碑，反映了加密货币从一个新兴资产类别转变为全球投资版图的核心部分。【原文：The crypto sector's market value hit $4 trillion on Friday, according to CoinGecko, marking a milestone that reflects its shift from a nascent asset class to a central part of the global investment landscape.】

item.title: 美联储古尔斯比：新关税公告可能推迟降息
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周五表示，不断 "滴滴答答 "地宣布新的关税，削弱了关税对价格只有一次性影响的观点，而且在关税最终走向不明确的情况下，央行将需要更多时间来决定降息是否合适。【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Austan Goolsbee on Friday said the constant "drip drip" of new tariff announcements undercuts the idea that tariffs have only a one-time impact on prices, and without clarity on where they will end up the central bank will need more time to decide if rate cuts are appropriate.】

item.title: 雪佛龙赢得埃克森案，但失去了时间、石油和数十亿美元
item.description: 埃克森美孚在阻止雪佛龙 550 亿美元收购赫斯交易的仲裁中败诉，但这家美国顶级石油生产商成功地将这一合作推迟了一年多，使其竞争对手损失了数十亿圭亚那石油收入，并减缓了整合速度。【原文：Exxon Mobil has lost its arbitration challenge to block Chevron's $55 billion Hess acquisition deal, but the top U.S. oil producer managed to delay the tie-up by over a year, costing its rival billions in lost Guyana oil revenue and slowing integration.】

item.title: 特朗普签署稳定币法律，加密货币行业瞄准主流应用
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周五签署了一项法律，为与美元挂钩的加密货币--稳定币--建立监管制度，这是一个里程碑，可能会为数字资产成为日常支付和转移资金的方式铺平道路。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday signed a law to create a regulatory regime for U.S.-dollar-pegged cryptocurrencies known as stablecoins, a milestone that could pave the way for the digital assets to become an everyday way to make payments and move money.】

item.title: 微软有可能签署欧盟人工智能实践准则，Meta 则拒绝接受指导方针
item.description: 微软公司总裁周五告诉路透社，微软很可能会签署欧盟的实践准则，以帮助企业遵守该集团具有里程碑意义的人工智能规则。【原文：Microsoft will likely sign the European Union's code of practice to help companies comply with the bloc's landmark artificial intelligence rules, its president told Reuters on Friday, while Meta Platforms rebuffed the guidelines.】

item.title: 沃勒尔表示，如果特朗普提出要求，他愿意领导美联储，但目前还没有联系
item.description: 主张立即降息的美联储理事克里斯-沃勒（Chris Waller）周五表示，如果美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）提出要求，他将接受美国央行行长一职，但迄今为止特朗普尚未就此事与他联系。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Chris Waller, an advocate for an immediate interest rate cut, said on Friday he would accept the job as head of the U.S. central bank if asked by President Donald Trump, but so far Trump has not contacted him about it.】

item.title: OpenAI 启动 5000 万美元基金，支持非营利组织和社区组织
item.description: ChatGPT 制造商 OpenAI 周五表示，该人工智能公司正在发起一项 5000 万美元的基金，以支持非营利组织和社区组织。【原文：ChatGPT maker OpenAI is launching a $50 million fund to support nonprofit and community organizations, the artificial intelligence company said on Friday.】

item.title: 2025 年上半年对冲基金吸引创纪录资金流入
item.description: 对冲基金提供商 HFR 的数据显示，今年上半年全球对冲基金的资金流入量达到了 2015 年以来最强劲的水平，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）新贸易政策的影响下，对冲基金在动荡的市场中越来越受欢迎。【原文：Global hedge funds had their strongest inflows in the first half of the year since 2015, gaining popularity in turbulent markets amid U.S. President Donald Trump's new trade policies, data from provider HFR showed.】

item.title: 贝克休斯称美国钻井商 12 周来首次增加石油/天然气钻井平台
item.description: 能源服务公司贝克休斯（Baker Hughes）周五在其密切关注的报告中称，美国能源公司本周增加了石油和天然气钻机，这是 12 周以来的首次。【原文：U.S. energy firms this week added oil and natural gas rigs for the first time in 12 weeks, energy services firm Baker Hughes said in its closely followed report on Friday.】

item.title: 中国称加拿大钢铁进口关税违反世贸组织规则
item.description: 中国驻渥太华大使馆周五批评加拿大本周对中国进口钢铁征收关税，称这违反了世界贸易组织（WTO）规则，扰乱了全球贸易秩序。【原文：The Chinese embassy in Ottawa criticized duties slapped by Canada this week on Chinese imported steel, saying on Friday they violated World Trade Organization (WTO) rules and disrupted the global trade order.】
